text:
Hi there! I have an old, existing project which I need to work on locally. I have node 12.18.0 and CLI v 1.1.7. I can run `hs init` , can get and paste in my key and give it a name. I then get the message `[SUCCESS] HubSpot.config.yml created with Personal Access Key.` BUT - no HubSpot.config.yml file has been created. I have searched everywhere but it does not exist so when I try `hs fetch [NAME]` I get the error: `[ERROR] The request failed because "mastered" was not found in portal XXXXXXX. resource not found`  I ahve also tried manually creating the file and also using `hs auth` but with the same result.
Anyone any ideas?
Quick question, when adding a content field (`richtext`), is it possible to set some flag so our marketeers can edit the content in fullscreen instead of using the small sidebar?
<@U6GNQ7JBU> I’m not 100% sure because I noticed it after the fact but it was either a request to fetch and overwrite local or a watch to sync local changes

quick question regarding the implementation of this particular snippet in the fields from a cloned instance of the HubSpot native form module:
```{
    "id" : "form.workflow",
    "name" : "follow_up_type_automation",
    "label" : "Add to workflow",
    "required" : true,
    "locked" : false,
    "visibility" : {
      "controlling_field" : null,
      "controlling_value_regex" : null,
      "operator" : "NOT_EMPTY",
      "access" : {
        "operator" : "HAS_ALL",
        "scopes" : [ "workflows-access" ]
      },
      "hidden_subfields" : null
    },
    "type" : "boolean",
    "default" : false
  }, ```

I was looking for some documentation for how the `access` parameters work with providing access to the workflows. How are those restrictions being parsed?
Are those params accessible for our common usage or are those tucked away for special HubSpot only usage? <@U7SL518D6> -- Any insights on this?

Hey All,

So I'm running into some issues uploading files with local development. When I attempt to run upload, Visual Studio Code gives me a success message, but nothing has changed in HubSpot. If I attempt to run the watch command,  I will get the "watcher is now watching" command, before my terminal locks up and I can no longer input any text without killing that terminal.

I had initially used watch to upload the following structure -> serverless-tutorial/.functions
This worked, but after these folders were uploaded to HubSpot, I have not been able to get any other changes to go through. Locally I currently have 2 files inside of my functions folder, and another subfolder called "test-folder" with a text file inside of it.

double check that your HubSpot.config.yml file is set to the correct portal

If you frequently work on multiple portals it’s easy to forget to update that if  you’re not using the `--portal=` parameter in your commands

Thanks for the quick response

I double check the portal and it is the correct portal. I can also see this reflected in the success message I get when I attempt to use the upload command

`[SUCCESS] Uploading Files from "serverless-tutorial" to "serverless-tutorial" in the Design Manager of portal XXXXXXX`

I have also confirmed that this portal is the same through the yml file and in my commands

Thank you for following up. I apologize that this question will come off dumb but I have to ask. After running the upload command or watch command *did you refresh your tab with the design manager open?* Sometimes that’s necessary to see the files updated in the UI
Or should I create a feature request?
That's not a dumb question at all. Unfortunately I have refreshed several times and reopened it in a new browser session as well.

just noticed this. in your first message you stated you uploaded `serverless-tutorial/.functions`
did you name the folder just `.functions`?
I did yes. The first time I went to upload it, both folders uploaded correctly as well

I think the core issue you’re having is that you didn’t name your .functions folder.

If you’re following the getting started guide you’ll want to name it `my-first-function.functions`
That is built for HubSpot usage. I would not rely on that for your own fields as that could change.
Just so I can make sure we are on the same page, you’re referring to having this kind of a button when you use a richtext field in a custom module right?
Thanks <@U7SL518D6> - what about the mechanism in which some of the rest of the params are integrated - i.e. the Salesforce campaign selection or the alternate email notifications?
Those are passed to the form tag itself, they are not in the form field json
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/5Cdocs/forms/add-to-cloned-form-module-4.jpg?width=2392&name=add-to-cloned-form-module-4.jpg>
ignore the highlighted part this is an image from our forms doc. Just trying to show you the form tag part

<@UGDF9EBPW> if the above image is what you are referring to, can you please add that to our ideas forum for sure and then link it back in the <#C26E7JT8V|ideas> channel so folks can :upvote: if they agree
This seems to have fixed the issue. Thank you.

Glad to hear it! I will report what you ran into to the engineers working on these features. I think we could possibly add an error message if you try to upload a module or function file without a name.
Hi <@U2H3TT8F2>. thanks for responding. This is exactly what I mean. Ill add the idea to the forum!
perfect! thank Teun, yea if you can add that and post to the ideas channel that’d be awesome. Thanks :slightly_smiling_face:

Word. I haven't dug to deeply into form integrations since dealing with the hiccup on workflow automation in a previous project. Any chance that that option would eventually be exposed for custom module dev?
As a small aside, if I need help with some of the lessons/ starting guides where would be the best place to ask? Should I start a new thread in the developers slack or should I go elseware?
Developers slack is likely the best place. For both APIs and CMS our developer advocates lurk in the developer slack and we help out when we can.
In addtion community members can often provide additional help and insight that HubSpotters might not
Awesome, thanks
Hey, <@URWEFV44E>! I just responded to your support ticket, *#3482867*. Let’s correspond there for now. I’ll update this thread once we’ve found a resolution.
Ok - thanks :slightly_smiling_face:
